Summary: Big, meteorite like speed, bright flourescent sea green like color, close to if not perfectly round.
divs: Sighting DetailsI was walking home from my friends house, when out of the corner of my eye I saw what I thought was a shooting star. First thought I turned around to make a wish on it and that's when I saw that it was really big for being a meteorite. It was heading in from the west going towards the east starting about 70 degrees above the horizon and lost site of it no thanks to the roof of a house when it was at about 50 degrees. Heading in a straight line, speed and apparent size it couldn't have hit more than a couple miles from me at the most, and if it had been a meteorite I'm very sure that I would have felt the ground shake from that kind of impact of one that big. So I waited about a minute and felt nothing. It was moving way to fast and happened to quickly for me to get a picture, but like any intelligent person i didn't move at all and took a picture of where I saw it go through to try to figure out the path it took and later on try to figure out where it landed. After doing all of this I immediately called my friend, whos house I just left to tell him what happened. My phone says I placed that call at 3:42 am (New York time).
